title: Building a Water Filter
brief: Clear muddy or debris-filled water using improvised filtering materials.
steps: Step 1: Find a container like bamboo, hollow log, or piece of clothing.
Step 2: Place several centimeters of sand in the bottom layer.
Step 3: Add a layer of crushed rock above the sand.
Step 4: Add a layer of charcoal above the crushed rock.
Step 5: Top with a layer of cloth as the final filter.
Step 6: Pour water slowly through the top, allowing it to filter through each layer.
Step 7: Collect filtered water from the bottom.
warnings: Filtering only removes debris and improves taste - you must still purify the water.
This method does NOT kill harmful organisms or remove chemical contamination.
Always boil or chemically treat filtered water before drinking.
